I'm just sitting here staring off into space and I can't help but wonder about everything. With the news I got yesterday it puts my own mortality into question. Do only the good die young? Should I look for the greater good in his death? I didn't know him all that well but it still hurts. I haven't cried since I don't know if I should where I didn't know him all that well. How is his brother going to hold up? Him and his brother were like the best of friends.. they looked out for each other.. but now its just up in the air. 

Just a friendly reminder to everyone... please please please make sure you tell the ones you care about that you do care because you never know... you might not have them tomorrow.

Yesterday is in the past... tomorrow is a mystery and today is a gift thats why they call it the present.

All donations go to The Jimmy Fund...

here's the info:

What: Chix With Stix vs. Boston Bruins Alumni

When: Friday, April 3, 2009 7:00pm - 9:00pm

Where: New England Sports Center
121 Donald Lynch Blvd.
Marlborough, MA

Cost: Adults $10
Children $5



About Chix with Stix

When Deb Rowe lost her fourteen-year-old cousin to leukemia, the idea for Chix with Stix began. Why not organize a team of female hockey players to take on the Bruins alums as a benefit for the Jimmy Fund? So that's just what she did, and it was a tremendous success.


Tragically, Deb's beloved grandmother died of breast cancer a short while later.


Now, Deb and the Chix with Stix team, skate, not only in memory of her cousin and Nana, but for everyone out there, who is fighting, surviving, aiding someone with cancer or mourning a loss from it.


The Chix with Stix games are now played to help raise money for breast cancer research.


Tickets are only $10 (adults) and $5 (children) and can be purchased through team members or at the door, on the evening of the event.


The bulk of the money raised is done with ads placed in the Boston Bruin's program book, which is available the evening of the event. If you would like to place an ad or simply make a donation, please contact Deb Rowe at: ChixwithStix2009@aol.com.


Please help the Chix with Stix in the fight against Cancer.

Please copy mine below, erase my answers putting yours in their place then post it in your journal! Please elaborate on the questions that would benefit from elaboration! One-word answers seldom help anyone out .

1. First Name: Heather

2. Age: 29... b-day is July 12th... what ya getting me?!?

3. Location: Dorchester, MA

4. Occupation: Ticket Sales at BHC

5. Partner? Toby... we've been together for almost 3 years

6. Kids: Tessah Michelle, 10

7. Brothers/Sisters: Christina, Janice, Sean and Lisa

8. Pets: None :( but I want some!!!

9. List the 3-5 biggest things going on in your life:
1. Working for 3 more days

2. Having a 3 days weekend

3. Still trying to recover from Cellullitis

10) Where and for what did you go to school for? 
I didn't finish High School so I never went to school for anything other then the major subjects.. now I wish I had finished and gone on to college.. would love to eventually become a nurse

11) Parents? 
Mother: Elizabeth O'Neill
Father: Richard Ludington

12) Who are some of your closest friends?
Toby, Janice, Crystal and Pete... don't have that many close friends anymore.. most of them I've lost contact with and others have out right stabbed me in the back.

Twilight featuring Robert Pattinson (of Harry Potter) and Kristen Stewart (of Panic Room). I cant wait!!!!!!! Twilight is a series of books written by Stephenie Meyer about vampires, humans and werewolves!! They are good reads if you can find them!!

Dear Santa...

Dear Santa,

This year I've been busy!

In June and I donated clothes to the needy (11 points). Last Thursday I punched in the arm (-10 points). Last Wednesday I donated bone marrow to in a life-saving procedure (300 points). In April I bought porn for (-10 points). Last month and I robbed a bank (-50 points).

Overall, I've been nice (241 points). For Christmas I deserve a Nintendo Wii!

Sincerely,
prepclerk

http://www.cnn.com/2007/SHOWBIZ/TV/02/08/anna.nicole.collapses/index.html

Reality TV star and former model Anna Nicole Smith was pronounced dead Thursday after being taken to a Florida hospital, a law enforcement source told CNN.
Happy New Year to all my friend!!!!

Did you do something you would never do?
Not that I can think of

Did you keep any New Year's Resolutions?
Yup.. I resolved to not making any New Year's Resolutions :)

Did anyone close to you give birth?
Jenn P. had a baby girl named Malia and Jenn C. had a son named Ryan.. I'm not really close to them but they are the only ones I can think of

Did anyone close to you die?
Yup... my ex boyfriend's Mom

Did you visit any countries?
Nope stayed in the US

What would you like to have in 2007 that you lacked in 2006?
A job

Will any date from 2006 stay etched in your memory forever?
A few personal ones

What was your biggest achievement of 2006?
Nothing I can think of

What was your biggest failure?
I don't like to think of anything as a failure, instead, lessons learned. (I'm keeping Lisa's answer for that)

Did you suffer illness or injury?
The common cold and the flu

What was the best thing you bought in '06?
Nothing that stands out in my mind

Did your behavior change over the year?
Nope... I'm still the same ol' Heather

Where did you spend most of your money?
Rent, take out and other random stuff that I probably didn't need

Are you happier than this time last year?
Yeah :)

What song will remind you of 2006?
Bless the Broken Road by Rascal Flatts

What do you wish you would have done more of?
Nothing

What do you wish you would have done less of?
Nothing

Did you fall in love in 2006?
Well the end of 2005 and still going strong

Did you get your heart broken in 2006?
Nope

Favorite TV program of '06?
Grey's Anatomy and Ghost Hunters

Do you hate anyone now that you didn't hate this time last year?
Nope, I still hate the bitch

What was the best movie you saw?
Cars

What was your greatest discovery?
That someone can love you unconditionally

What did you do on your birthday and how old were you?
Stayed at home and I turned 28

What one thing would have made your year immeasurably more satisfying?
Keeping my job

How would you describe your personal fashion concept of 2006?
Casual and comfy :)


Friends

Who was the best new person you met?
No one really... everyone I know now I already knew

Who did you wish you did not meet?
No one

Who was your best friend?
Toby

Who was your enemy?
Julie

Who do you miss?
Tessah... but I always miss her

Tell us a valuable life lesson you learned in 2006:
Nothing

What will you always remember about 2006?
All the times I spent with Toby before he moved in and our time together was limited


Aspirations for 2007...

What do you want to do in '07 that you couldn't in '06?
It's not a matter of couldn't but... get my own place

Any resolutions?
Nope... I've given up on resolutions

What will be different about 2007 than 2006?
Who knows

Do you want to make more friends in 2007?
Sure

Dear Santa...

Dear Santa,

This year I've been busy!

Last Saturday I gave a wet willie, then I took it back (-5 points). Last week I donated bone marrow to in a life-saving procedure (300 points). In January I had a shoot-out with rival gang lords on the 5 near LA (-76 points). In September I helped across the street (6 points). Last Friday I put money in 's expired parking meter (14 points).

Overall, I've been nice (239 points). For Christmas I deserve a new dolly!

Sincerely,
prepclerk
